Om Raut's retelling of the Ramayana in "Adipurush" doesn't live up to its potential. The movie focuses more on action and adventure than on exploring the deeper aspects of human nature that make the epic stories so powerful. The changes made to the story are only surface-level, and the film fails to provide a fresh interpretation.Raut's aim is to attract a younger audience who enjoy video games and superhero movies, but this approach sacrifices emotional depth and intellectual engagement. While the action scenes are exciting, the movie lacks emotional weight. Raut and his co-writer, Manoj Muntashir, take some creative liberties with the story, but they mainly focus on the villains instead of exploring the moral complexities of the characters. This makes the narrative feel rigid and devoid of nuance.It's unfortunate that in modern times, our epic stories are often simplified, leaving no room for the heroes and villains to negotiate or for the audience to ponder the intricacies of human behavior. In "Adipurush," the characters are either portrayed as perfect or completely evil, lacking the complexity that would make them relatable and realistic. The absence of certain characters further contributes to the shallow storytelling.The actors' performances also leave something to be desired. Prabhas, who plays Raghava, lacks the emotional depth needed to portray a character torn between his commitment to virtue and his personal struggles. His delivery of Hindi dialogue lacks the necessary emotion and variation. Other actors, like Sunny Singh and Devdutta Nage, also fail to impress in their respective roles.Saif Ali Khan's portrayal of Lankesh/Raavana is exaggerated and lacks depth, with little insight into the complexity of the character. The attempts to explore Raavana's mind through the conversations among his ten heads come across as amateurish. The combination of live-action and motion capture, while technically impressive, doesn't add much to the storytelling and often looks artificial.The female characters in the movie are poorly developed. Kriti Sanon's Janaki has little impact in the story's male-dominated conflicts, and Sonal Chauhan's Mandodari is given minimal importance after a few lines. Raut's technical skills are evident in capturing the darker aspects of Lankesh, but overall, the movie lacks originality. The depiction of Lanka resembles Gotham City's ruins, and the monsters and primates seem borrowed from other movies. The digitally-created character Sugriv lacks expression, and the romantic scenes between Raghav and Sita feel like generic fashion brand commercials. The music by Ajay Atul shows promise but gets overshadowed by the film's eagerness to focus on the action.In terms of the battle sequences, the visual effects and action lack innovation, relying on outdated techniques that may appear flashy but ultimately fall short. Overall, "Adipurush" fails to capture the emotional depth and intensity that could have made it a compelling retelling of the Ramayana.

5:2 Headed Raavan: Fun and CreativeStory Alterations: While adaptations often take creative liberties, the narrative of "Adipurush" felt noticeably altered from the expected. The movie had the potential to be an epic retelling but unfortunately missed the mark in its delivery.

Title: Adipurush: A Magnificent Epic That Transcends BoundariesMy rating :10/10Adipurush, the highly anticipated Indian epic fantasy film directed by Om Raut, is a visual extravaganza that brings the ancient tale of the Ramayana to life on the big screen. With its grand scale, breathtaking visuals, and powerful performances, Adipurush succeeds in capturing the essence of the timeless mythological narrative.The film revolves around the legendary characters of Lord Rama and the demon king Ravana, played brilliantly by Prabhas and Saif Ali Khan, respectively. Prabhas delivers a captivating performance as Lord Rama, exuding grace, valor, and righteousness. His portrayal is both stoic and emotive, allowing audiences to connect with his character on a deeper level. Saif Ali Khan, on the other hand, brings a charismatic and menacing presence to the role of Ravana, showcasing his versatility as an actor.One of the standout aspects of Adipurush is its awe-inspiring visual effects. The movie boasts stunning cinematography and meticulous attention to detail in every frame. The larger-than-life sets, breathtaking landscapes, and intricate costumes transport viewers to a mythical world filled with gods, demons, and epic battles. The action sequences are choreographed with finesse, and the use of CGI is seamless, enhancing the overall cinematic experience.Om Raut's direction is commendable, as he skillfully balances the grandeur of the story with intimate character moments. He manages to present the conflict between good and evil with depth and nuance, allowing for a multi-dimensional exploration of the characters' motivations and dilemmas. The screenplay, written by Prakash Kapadia, masterfully adapts the Ramayana into a contemporary narrative that resonates with audiences of all backgrounds.The supporting cast, including Kriti Sanon as Sita and Sunny Singh as Lakshmana, deliver commendable performances, adding depth to the story and complementing the lead actors effectively. Their chemistry and camaraderie contribute to the emotional core of the film.While Adipurush is an enthralling cinematic experience, there are a few minor flaws that prevent it from achieving perfection. At times, the pacing feels slightly uneven, with certain scenes dragging on longer than necessary. Additionally, some character arcs could have been further developed to provide a more well-rounded narrative.Despite these minor shortcomings, Adipurush is an extraordinary achievement in Indian cinema. It is a testament to the immense talent and dedication of the cast and crew involved. The film's powerful storytelling, breathtaking visuals, and stellar performances make it a must-watch for fans of epic fantasies and lovers of mythological tales.Overall, Adipurush transports the audience into a mythical realm, where gods and demons clash in a battle that transcends time. It is a cinematic spectacle that celebrates the age-old tale of good versus evil while leaving a lasting impact on the viewer.

Adipurus" is an absolute disaster of a film and undeniably the worst movie of the year. From the opening scene to the closing credits, this cinematic trainwreck is a perfect example of how not to make a movie. The film's lackluster plot, abysmal acting, and nonsensical execution make it an excruciating experience for any unsuspecting viewer.The screenplay is riddled with clichés, plot holes, and contrived twists that leave the audience scratching their heads in confusion. The pacing is uneven, with tedious exposition followed by rushed action sequences that fail to build any tension or emotional investment.The performances in this film are shockingly bad. The cast seems to have been chosen based on their ability to deliver wooden dialogue and display minimal range of emotions. It's as if the actors themselves were aware of the film's lack of quality and couldn't muster any enthusiasm for their roles. Even veteran actors who have delivered commendable performances in the past fall flat in this cinematic disaster.Another major flaw of "adipurus" lies in its technical aspects. The cinematography is uninspired, with poorly framed shots and lackluster visual effects that only serve to amplify the film's already glaring issues. The editing is choppy and disjointed, making it difficult to follow the already convoluted storyline.Furthermore, the film's attempt at social message is painfully forced and falls flat. It tries to tackle complex themes such as human thought and the consequences of human arrogance, but its clumsy execution only trivializes these subjects. The dialogue is clunky and overly expository, leaving no room for subtlety or meaningful exploration of the film's underlying themes.To add insult to injury, the film's ending is a complete letdown. After enduring an agonizing hour and a half of mediocrity, the resolution is rushed and unsatisfying. It's as if the filmmakers gave up halfway through and decided to wrap things up hastily, leaving the audience with a profound sense of disappointment.In conclusion, "notpurush" is a prime example of wasted potential. With its promising premise and talented cast, it had all the ingredients for a compelling mythological drama. However, due to its poor execution, lackluster performances and a meandering plot, it falls spectacularly flat on its face. Save yourself the agony and steer clear of this cinematic catastrophe.

Where do I even begin with the abysmal disaster that is Adipurush? This movie epitomizes everything that can go wrong in the film industry. From the horrendous acting to the lackluster storyline, it is a complete letdown on every front.Let's start with the cast. Prabhas, who is known for his charisma and talent, fails to deliver even a remotely convincing performance. His expressions are wooden, and his dialogue delivery is monotonous throughout the entire film. It feels like he sleepwalked through his role, showing zero effort to bring any depth or emotion to his character.Saif Ali Khan as the antagonist was equally disappointing. His portrayal of Ravana, a legendary and complex character, was nothing short of laughable. Instead of capturing the essence of the character, Khan came across as comical and completely miscast. It's hard to take him seriously as a formidable foe for Prabhas' character.The screenplay and dialogue writing in Adipurush are shockingly poor. The dialogues lack impact and fail to create any memorable moments. The narrative is disjointed, with scenes that seem randomly stitched together. The pacing is incredibly sluggish, making the already tedious storyline feel even more agonizing.The visual effects, touted as one of the film's highlights, are a massive disappointment. The CGI is poorly executed and lacks finesse, leaving the mythical elements of the story looking cheap and unconvincing. It's evident that the filmmakers cut corners and failed to invest in high-quality effects, resulting in a subpar visual experience.Moreover, the music and background score are forgettable, failing to elevate any of the film's scenes. The songs feel forced and unnecessary, serving as mere distractions from the lackluster plotline.Adipurush's biggest flaw is its disrespect towards the source material. It takes a beloved mythological tale and reduces it to a mindless and shallow spectacle. The film lacks depth, fails to explore the characters' motivations, and completely disregards the cultural and historical significance of the story it attempts to portray.In conclusion, Adipurush is a colossal disappointment and a waste of time and resources. The poor acting, weak screenplay, shoddy visual effects, and overall lack of creativity make it an unbearable cinematic experience. I would strongly advise against subjecting yourself to this cinematic disaster.

Warning - You will get very angry after watching this movie.Don't know where to really start from, this is an epic disappointment on all levels. And the fears really came true, the VFX is so poor that, you start to wonder if this is a beta version of a video game launched several years ago, it is that cartoonish and was an eyesore. Acting wise, none really standout, though the aggressive version of Lord Rama played into the strengths of Prabhas, he was just okayish, Kriti had just to smile and weep. Even with a caricaturish characterisation of Ravan, it was Saif who had put some genuine effort among all the cast and crew. Screenplay is so lazy, the dialogues at places are as cringeworthy as hell. Technically, for a 500Cr project, this has to be the biggest scam in Indian Cinema in the recent times, nothing much about cinematography, as the entire movie was shot indoor, editing is pathetic, action choreography was straight out of many Hollywood movies. Only saving grace is the songs of Ajay-Atul and the score of Sachet-Parampara, it really elevates the proceedings.

The visual effects are often subpar, with some scenes looking unfinished or even amateurish.The dialogue is often cringe-worthy, with some lines feeling like they were written by a teenager.The film's superhero movie parallels are jarring and out of place, and they often detract from the film's overall impact.The film's portrayal of certain characters has been met with disapproval from some viewers, including Lord Rama's depiction as an Angry Young man.One of the worst movies ever made. It is a nonsensical, poorly-acted, and unintentionally hilarious film that is sure to leave you scratching your head. The plot is non-existent, the characters are one-dimensional, and the dialogue is cringeworthy. However, the film's flaws are also its greatest strengths. The Room is so bad that it is actually good. It is a cult classic that has been praised by critics and audiences alike.If you are looking for a good laugh, then I highly recommend. It is a truly unique and unforgettable film that you will never forget.

review_title: Adipurush: A Disastrous Mess of a Film
review_text: As a fan of epic fantasy films, I had high hopes for "Adipurush," but it turned out to be an absolute trainwreck from start to finish. This movie is a prime example of how even a star-studded cast and a big budget cannot save a poorly executed film.First and foremost, the storytelling in "Adipurush" is utterly confusing and incoherent. The plot jumps around haphazardly, leaving the audience bewildered and struggling to connect the dots. There is a severe lack of character development, and the motivations of the main characters remain unclear throughout the entire film. It feels as if the writers themselves were unsure of what they were trying to convey, resulting in a convoluted mess.While the movie boasts of impressive visual effects, they are merely a smokescreen to distract from the lack of substance. The CGI is overused to the point of absurdity, and it often feels like you're watching an animated film rather than a live-action epic. The action sequences, which should have been the film's saving grace, are poorly choreographed and lack any real excitement or intensity. It's a disappointment to see such potential wasted on lackluster execution.The performances in "Adipurush" are equally disappointing. The usually charismatic and talented cast members are given little to work with, and their performances come across as wooden and uninspired. Even the great actors struggle to salvage the poorly written dialogue, leaving the audience cringing at the forced and unnatural exchanges.Moreover, the film suffers from severe pacing issues. It drags on for an excruciatingly long time, with unnecessary subplots and filler scenes that add nothing to the overall story. The excessive runtime only adds to the frustration and makes the experience more unbearable.Finally, the film's attempts to tackle complex themes and messages fall flat. The half-hearted social commentary feels forced and poorly integrated into the narrative, making it seem like an afterthought rather than a genuine attempt at depth.In conclusion, "Adipurush" is an absolute disaster of a film. It fails on every level, from storytelling and character development to visual effects and performances. It's a waste of both time and money. I would strongly advise against subjecting yourself to this cinematic catastrophe.

Adipurush, directed by Om Raut, is an epic retelling of the revered Hindu mythological tale, the Ramayan. With its perfect casting, melodic music, incredible graphics, and breathtaking war sequences, the film successfully captivated me. Adipurush showcases the journey of Lord Ram, portrayed impeccably by Prabhas, and highlights his heroic exploits in the battle against the formidable Ravan.One of the film's standout aspects is the perfect casting of Prabhas as Lord Ram. His demeanour exudes the noble qualities and righteousness that the character demands. Prabhas's screen presence and dedication to his role elevate the heroism of Sri Ram, making his character truly engaging and inspiring.The melodic music of Adipurush adds depth and emotion to the storytelling. The film's soundtrack beautifully complements the narrative, enhancing the audience's connection with the characters and their journey. The songs and background score resonate well with the mythological theme, providing a rich and immersive experience.Indian makers have left no stone unturned in creating incredible graphics and visually stunning war sequences. The grandeur and attention to detail in these scenes are truly commendable. The battles are choreographed and executed with precision, making them a spectacle to behold. The Indian film industry showcases its technical prowess through the impressive visual effects, which enhance the mythological elements of the story.Adipurush does justice to the important episodes of the Ramayan, whether it's the encounter with Jatayuvu, the meeting with Shabari, or the iconic scene of Hanuman burning Lanka. Each episode is beautifully shot, capturing the essence and significance of these moments. The attention to detail and the portrayal of these episodes add depth and meaning to the overall narrative.The film presents a strong portrayal of Ravan, who serves as the antagonist to Sri Ram's heroism. The character of Ravan is depicted with depth and complexity, showcasing his power and intelligence. This adds to the overall conflict and raises the stakes for Lord Ram, creating a compelling dynamic between the two characters.However, one of the drawbacks of Adipurush is that most of the sequences are shot in dark settings. While this might add to the intensity and mood of certain scenes, it results in a lack of colorful skies, vibrant flowers, and visually appealing clothing. This absence of vivid colors can make the film feel somewhat monotonous visually, especially considering the grandeur and beauty associated with the Ramayan. Most negative reviews are nit picking, ignoring the larger picture.In conclusion, Adipurush is a visually stunning and emotionally captivating retelling of the Ramayan. Prabhas delivers a remarkable performance as Lord Ram, and the film's music, graphics, and war sequences leave a lasting impact. While the dark settings might be a drawback for some viewers, the overall experience of the film is engrossing, and it successfully brings to life the epic tale of good versus evil. I am no big devotee of Sri Ram but this elevated my reverence for him. I am proud that an Indian has made such an epic film. Adipurush is a must-watch for fans of mythology and epic storytelling.

review_title: A Modern Misstep in Ramayana's Retelling
review_text: "Adipurush" proves to be a disappointing rendition of the classic Ramayana tale, attempting to modernize it in a way that comes across as cheap and poorly executed. The decision to take the story to a street-level setting only serves to strip away the grandeur and depth of the original narrative, leaving behind a hollow and disconnected adaptation.With its emotional core missing, "Adipurush" disappoints viewers who anticipated a more heartfelt reimagining. While modernization has potential, the film's failure to capture the essence of the Ramayana leaves it wanting.In sum, "Adipurush" stands as a cautionary example of attempting to modernize a beloved classic without preserving its emotional depth. The film's impersonal approach and disconnection from the original narrative rob it of the intended sentiment, resulting in a lackluster cinematic experience.

review_title: A Disappointing Adaptation: Adipurush Falls Short of Expectations
review_text: Adipurush, a highly anticipated movie based on the epic Ramayan, falls disappointingly short of expectations. From poor costume design and questionable creative choices to inconsistent storytelling and a lack of depth in understanding the source material, the film fails to capture the essence and grandeur of the original narrative. The subpar dialogue writing further hampers the film's impact, while inaccurate portrayals of key characters and settings contribute to a lack of authenticity. Adipurush ultimately fails to deliver a satisfying cinematic experience, leaving viewers longing for a more respectful and engaging adaptation of the beloved epic.

Very few actors in the current generation can pull off mythological or periodic roles with ease and conviction, and Prabhas is one among them. The actor has an unmatched aura and royalty, and Adipurush couldn't have been any better if some other actor had played Lord Sri Rama. The PAN-India star amazes big time with his charisma, body language, and dialogue delivery, and he fits the bill perfectly as Lord Rama. The way he utters lengthy dialogues and his screen presence are indomitable.One more best thing to have happened to Adipurush is Saif Ali Khan. The team had an uphill task of casting an actor who could match Prabhas, and they indeed did a great job by casting Saif Ali Khan. The star actor makes the film even fiery with his incredible performance as Lankesh, i.e., Ravanasura. Saif Ali Khan performs it to the tee and has scored brownie points too.Sita character is definitely a challenge for someone like Kriti Sanon, who mostly played glamorous roles in her career, but boy, she is perfect as Janaki, aka Sita. Kriti's divine looks and her mature performance adds depth to the proceedings. Devdatte Nage, the Marathi actor, breathed life into the role of Lord Hanuman. Sunny Singh, Vatsal Sheth, and Sonal Chauhan pass muster.Om Raut's strength lies in showcasing the drama, and he handled the first half in a very neat manner. There are many well-executed sequences in the first hour, including the Jatayu - Ravana fight, Hanuman meeting Rama for the first time, the face-off between Sugriva and Vaali, and Hanuman setting Lanka on fire. These aspects are something that are very familiar to the audience, but the way Om Raut has presented them intrigues one. Ajay-Atul duo's songs are superb, to say the least, and the background score has lifted the movie in many areas.

Adhipurush movie is superb and every character in this movie is touching our hearts and their suited there role in this movie and vfx also improved after the teaser I can give 10 stars
livers an extraordinary performance as Lord Ram. His portrayal effortlessly captures the essence of the character, showcasing both his strength as a warrior and his unwavering devotion as a prince. Prabhas's dedication to the role is evident in every scene, making him a perfect fit for the epic tale.Saif Ali Khan's portrayal of the formidable antagonist, Ravana, is an absolute treat to watch. He brings an unmatched intensity to the role, infusing Ravana with a complex mix of power, arrogance, and vulnerability. Saif's nuanced performance elevates the character, making him more than just a typical villain. The confrontations between Prabhas and Saif are electrifying and undoubtedly some of the highlights of the film.Director Om Raut's vision and storytelling prowess shine through in every frame of Adipurush. The grandeur and scale of the production are breathtaking, and the attention to detail in recreating ancient settings is commendable. The visual effects are top-notch, seamlessly blending with the narrative and adding an extra layer of realism to the mythical world. The battle sequences are awe-inspiring, leaving you at the edge of your seat, completely absorbed in the epic clash between good and evil.The supporting cast also deserves praise for their outstanding performances. Kriti Sanon as Sita brings grace and strength to the character, while Sunny Singh as Laxman displays unwavering loyalty and a fiery spirit. They add depth to the narrative, complementing the central characters perfectly.The music and background score by Ajay-Atul are mesmerizing, capturing the essence of the story and enhancing the emotional impact of key moments. The songs are beautifully choreographed, adding to the overall visual splendor of the film.Adipurush is more than just a retelling of a mythological tale; it's a celebration of our rich cultural heritage. It explores timeless themes of love, sacrifice, and the triumph of good over evil. The film not only entertains but also sparks a sense of pride and reverence for our mythology.In conclusion, Adipurush is an extraordinary cinematic experience that deserves all the accolades it receives. Prabhas's stellar performance, Saif Ali Khan's compelling portrayal, and Om Raut's masterful direction come together to create an epic spectacle that will leave you in awe. This movie sets a new benchmark for Indian cinema and is a must-watch for anyone who appreciates grand storytelling and visual splendor.

review_title: The worst movie In the world
review_text: Adipurush, if one remembers, was supposed to be an modern adaptation of Ramayan and hence the makers chose to have a free run with the creative liberties in this film and it all went wrong .Adipurush itself starts from the middle of Ramayana where lord Ram was sent to the jungles for 14 years exile . Hence the film doesn't have any build up to any character.First, the characters itself have no introduction whatsoever. Makers assume since we know Ramayana, so no need to introduce anyone properly. Lord Ram is just introduced through some pictures in the opening credit while laxman and Sita ma have even further lower introduction. Honestly saying if one didn't tell you that Sunny Singh is laxman, you probably won't know. Jatayu pops up randomly and gets to poorest adieu . It's almost as if Lord Ram doesn't even know who Jatayu is. Bali , the brother of Sugreev, has absolutely no introduction.Next, the setting. If it's a modern adaptation of Ramayana, then why is the Lord Ram side shown to be taken straight from Ramayana but Lanka and it's people especially Raavan are shown as people of some Azguard (Thor) ? Clearly there is inconsistency . If you remember the original Ramayana, both Ram and Raavan side had almost similar kind of dresses with kings wearing king like dresses etc. Here, both sides wear dresses belonging to opposite poles.Next, the execution. It's horrendous. Bali and Sugreev's fight is the worst looking one which gets over in no time without any introduction to Bali. As they fight, you can't even understand who is Bali and who is Sugreev. The part where Sita gets kidnapped by the Sadhu is not accurate. The Sadhu i believe never gave evil smiles . Jatayu's adieu is just ignored. In the earlier Ramayana, Jatayu has a heartfelt conversation with lord Ram in his arms before dying but here, Jatayu is just treated like a random bird. Last but not the least, everything on the lankan side is so poorly executed. Lord Hanuman burns Lanka with his tail but it barely burns, just random explosions here and there that's it.Next, I want to talk about Indrajith and Vibhishan. My god what kind of portrayal is this? Indrajit looks like a party animal from some Noida club and he possesses powers of Flash !! The level of creative liberties they took!! Vibhishan is so hard to believe he's vibhishan as he doesn't act like him only . They all got weird tattoos on their body especially indrajith . Itna bhi modern nahi karna tha !!VFX and dialogues. Let's not talk about it you already know how it is. The final war sequence also looks so cartoonish that it sucks the essence out of it.Let's talk about Raavan played by Saif. He does try very hard to make Raavan look menacing. His character is even given a terrifying bgm . However, the rest things of his looks so weird. His 10 heads rendered VFX looks hilarious at best. His hairstyle is again Noida Gurugram style. He feeds non veg to his dragon vehicle (why is non veg shown in this film at first place?). All these creative choices just don't fit Raavan. The makers have just played around with the Lanka side while fearfully avoiding any creative changes on Ram side .Songs are good as well as the BGM. That's the only reason I gave this film 2 stars.Prabhas as lord Ram should never have been there. He's just angry faced , barely smiles and has no expressions at all. His body is an entire VFX render throughout.Overall, i thought KBKJ was the worst film this year but Adipurush beats it by a mile solely because it has ruined an epic saga so close to all Hindus. Adipurush just shows a part of the entire Ramayana that too with little to no detailing with its running time being 3 hrs and back in 1992, the Yugo Sako version showed all details and the entire tale of Ram in under 2hrs 50 mins. It clearly shows the quality difference of the makers .

Adipurush picture is excellent and worth watching. This type of movie is not prepared before. Full of actions, animation, and it is an excellent presentation. Though the picture is based on Ramayan but its objectives are to show the actions of the story in an animated and different way. This type of presentation never seen before in Indian Cinema. Prabhas is excellent as Raghunandan. Saif Ali Khan as Ravann also done his part very well. Kriti Sanon is also very good as Janki. The film has very less diaglogues and more of animation and action. Please dont watch with previous mindset of Ramayan seen in Drama, Picture or Serials. Every Ramayan presentation has got its own values Ram and all others Charactor but this is an action and animated film. Everytime you will looking at something new and exciting. Hats off to the director Om Raut.

review_title: It's a fight for justice in marvel format
review_text: Not sure why this movie had upset a lot of film fans , it nothing less than a marvel superhero films , I believe makers had wrongly portrayed & marketed adipurush in traditional Ramayana. It's a fight of ram for his beloved wife who was adbucted by Ravan . There are some issues with film like the fight could have been 15 min shorter and huppa huya sing would have been added. Instead of designing ravana army like comic characters they could have been in human formats with rakshak attire .. & ravana is demon he can have many forms and many hair styles there is nothing wrong in it ..no body is sure how ravana used to look .. when will smith made Jesus character or when askhay made Krishna's character did we comment on their outlook .. it's a film made for future kids and portrayed characters as superheroes.. I don't think anyone would have made adipurush better than what it is .. however only lack is at the time of promotions team could have taken care with kid format marketing and portraying vanarsaina etc.

I have given ten in order support the film audience who watch films with an open mind instead of spreading hatred.

review_title: Watch it before making up your mind
review_text:
I heard all the complaints from people, but decided to watch it before making up my mind about it. After watching it I can say with assurance that people are overhyping the issues with this movie. A 5 second dialogue does not represent the vision of the makers. This is not a remake of Ramanand Sagar's Ramayana. This a vision of the director. A character's appearance does not change their historically accurate attributes. There are definite issues with movie, but making an assertion without giving it a chance is unfair. Moreover, the movie is made for close to $70 million. Movies like Ant Man Quantumania and Black Adam are made for almost triple the budget. The VFX is great considering the amount of VFX and the relatively low budget.Cons:
1. There was no need to CGI Sri Ram. Prabhas's normal built was acceptable.2. They could have hired an actor who is already buffed to play Hanuman Ji. There was no need to CGI. A lot of VFX budget could have been saved on the above two points.3. The introduction of Sri Ram did not need to have so much CGI. That scene felt like the CGI artists showing off what they can do. Instead, that budget could have been utilized in improving the movements of Jamvant and the Bali-Sugriv fight.4. Someone better could have played Lakshman Ji. The actor could not do justice to the nature of Lakshman ji.Pros:
1. I expected Saif to be the worst part of the movie, but turns out he was the best. He played the character really well.2. The who played Hanuman Ji was great.3. The visuals were mostly great.Overall, I welcome negative reviews for the movie, but I urge people to watch the movie legitimately before making up their mind, weather its in a theatre or on an OTT platform.

The epic drama in a linear way would not be enough to attract audience. The character look for Ravan is well in line with known information like tall height, devotee of shiva are well portrayed. It is worth to take the kids for this epic drama.

review_title: It is absolutely pathetic how they ruined an epic just like it's no big deal
review_text:
"Adipurush" is a regrettable endeavor that seeks to malign the sacredness of our revered epic, the Ramayana. It leaves a significant black mark on the piousness and sanctity cherished by ardent followers of Sanatana Dharma, both in India and across the globe. Despite the mess created by the team, they display audaciousness by releasing the film, and instead of offering an apology, some members even attempt to justify their actions on a news platform, trying to sugarcoat the flaws they have served to the audience. In conclusion, "Adipurush" fails as an attempt to honor and represent the revered epic, Ramayana. Its disrespectful execution tarnishes the sanctity of the source material and disappoints devout followers worldwide. It is a regrettable production that should be avoided in favor of more authentic and respectful adaptations available through literary works and well-established television series and films. Shri Ramanand Sagar's Ramayana TV Series (1987) and Yogo Sako et al. Ramayana: The Legend of Prince Rama (1992).

This is lesson to all the Directors who will make any movie based on Indian epic. This punishment should be given for deliberately misguiding the public sentiments.

If the young minds of today get their understanding of Valmiki Ramayana from this movie then I don't know what will happen in near future.If this will be their Raavan then i don't know what exactly will they think of Ramayana in the first place. Raavan has an attire of an islamic dictator. He has been shown wearing a t-shirt along with leather straps over him with spiky hairstyle and rather non-sense get up. He is shown riding a bat but there is no mention of why he is riding a bat, is that pushpak vimaan or what. Characters around him are just goofy men or rather cartoons in his army who behave like lord of the rings character. Indrajit is shown as a guy having powers of Flash and attire of Connor McGregor. I can't imagine this being Ramayana.The first point of Introduction of Rama is pathetic. Shree Ram is shown as fighting some random CGI demons. Who are they? Why are they attacking Sita? Nothing is told as if it's a cartoon film. Even with such a story like that of Ramayana, Raavana's motivations are so childish and vague that we still don't know what he wants. Now if you don't think this was intentional then I don't know what shows their intention.Overall this movie is an unbareable garbage which no devotee of Shree Rama or any person in general deserves to witness and atleast not by spending money. Don't watch it.

review_title: A Disappointing Mess: Adipurush Fails to Live Up to the Hype
review_text: Adipurush, the much-anticipated film touted as a grand retelling of a legendary Hindu epic, arrived with immense hype and expectations. However, it pains me to say that this cinematic offering falls flat on multiple levels. From its uninspiring screenplay to lackluster performances, Adipurush fails to deliver the epic experience it promised. Let's dive deeper into the reasons why this film left me thoroughly disappointed.Lackluster Storytelling and Screenplay:One of the major flaws plaguing Adipurush is its lackluster storytelling and weak screenplay. The film attempts to retell the epic tale of Ramayana, a narrative that is ingrained in the cultural fabric of India. However, the narrative fails to captivate and engage the audience. The pacing is uneven, with significant gaps in the storyline that leave viewers perplexed and disconnected. The characters lack depth and development, making it difficult to emotionally invest in their journey. The film could have benefitted from a more focused and engaging screenplay that effectively conveyed the essence of theDespite a star-studded cast, the performances in Adipurush leave much to be desired. Prabhas, known for his charismatic presence, fails to shine as Lord Rama. His portrayal lacks the emotional depth and conviction required to bring the character to life. Similarly, Saif Ali Khan's performance as Ravana falls flat. The iconic villain is reduced to a caricature, lacking the complexity and intensity that would make him a worthy adversary. The supporting cast does little to salvage the film, with forgettable performances that fail to leave a lasting impression. Overall, the lack of compelling performances only adds to the film's mediocrity.One would expect a film of this scale to boast impressive visual effects, but sadly, Adipurush disappoints in this department as well. The CGI (computer-generated imagery) used throughout the film is often jarring and unconvincing. The mythical creatures and grand battle sequences, meant to be awe-inspiring, come across as amateurish and disjointed. The poor execution of visual effects detracts from the overall viewing experience and makes it difficult to immerse oneself in the world of Adipurush.The director's vision plays a pivotal role in bringing a story to life on the big screen. In the case of Adipurush, the direction seems to be lacking a clear sense of purpose. The film veers between tones, unsure of whether it wants to be a grand epic or a commercial entertainer. This lack of coherence is evident in the disjointed narrative and inconsistent characterization. The director fails to provide a cohesive vision that could have elevated Adipurush to its potential greatness.Adipurush, being an adaptation of a revered Hindu epic, carries a responsibility to handle its source material with utmost respect and sensitivity. Unfortunately, the film falters in this regard. Certain creative liberties taken in the name of storytelling come across as insensitive and disrespectful to the religious sentiments associated with the Ramayana. These choices, instead of adding depth, alienate a significant section of the audience, and contribute to the overall disappointment of the film.In conclusion, Adipurush fails to live up to its grand promises and falls short on multiple fronts. Its lackluster storytelling, weak screenplay, underwhelming performances, incoherent visual effects, and cultural insensitivity make it a disappointing cinematic experience. As an audience member, I was left longing for a film that could do justice to the epic tale of Ramayana. Sadly, Adipurush does not fulfill that longing and instead offers aforgettable rendition of a beloved story.

I suggest not to watch this movie and don't encourage them for making fun of our religion and emotions. In this way at least they will understand that not only topic but also story and acting are necessary in a movie. They will also understand that just because of the name of religion they can not make a superhit movie. It also needs emotions, dialogues, acting and the actors who fit in the role. In this movie actors don't fit in the role, the dialogues are very cheap, VFX effects are not good and most important thing the story line doesn't even match the real Ramayan. So, I prefer not to watch the movie.

review_title: Deep Disappointment in the Movie Adipurush & it's production team
review_text: Title: Deep Disappointment in the Movie AdipurushRating: ⭐I recently had the opportunity to watch the movie Adipurush, and I must express my deep disappointment regarding the artistic choices made by the filmmakers. It is disheartening to witness the shocking level of depravity displayed in creating this movie. It begs the question: Om Raut and Manoj Muntasir, were you attempting to turn the sacred Ramayana into a comedy genre? The disrespect shown towards such a revered epic is truly regrettable, and I feel compelled to express my disapproval of this project and everyone involved.Additionally, the VFX effects used in the movie were underwhelming and failed to meet even basic standards. They appeared amateurish, comparable to something a high school student who has just learned a few tricks from YouTube might create for casual entertainment. The entire claimed budget of 600 crores feels like a complete farce, raising concerns about possible financial irregularities. It is my sincere belief that the appropriate authorities, such as the ED, should investigate any potential money laundering angles.Furthermore, I take exception to Manoj M's claim that Katha Vachaks in India utilize such language. Throughout my life, I have heard numerous Katha Vachaks who narrate the stories of the Ramayana with utmost respect and reverence. Never have I encountered anyone resorting to insults or disrespectful depictions of the holy Ramayana or its cherished characters.In conclusion, Adipurush has left a bitter taste, failing to honor the sacredness and dignity of the Ramayana. It is disheartening to witness such a misguided attempt to portray a beloved epic. I hope that future filmmakers approach these revered stories with the respect and artistic integrity they deserve.I wish IMdb gives an option to say "Movie not worth ANY Rating".

review_title: "Aadipurush: A Majestic Retelling of an Epic Saga"
review_text: Introduction:Aadipurush, the highly anticipated film directed by Om Raut, has taken the cinematic world by storm. Set to be an extraordinary visual spectacle, this epic retelling of the ancient Hindu epic Ramayana has received a myriad of positive reviews, captivating audiences with its grandeur, impeccable performances, and profound storytelling. Amidst the acclaim, it is important to address and challenge the negative reviewers who fail to recognize the film's artistic brilliance and cultural significance.Captivating Visuals and Grandeur:Aadipurush is a visual feast for the eyes, showcasing the best of modern filmmaking techniques. The breathtaking cinematography, coupled with mesmerizing set designs and stunning visual effects, transports the viewers to a mythical world filled with gods, demons, and extraordinary battles. The scale and attention to detail are awe-inspiring, immersing the audience in a rich and vibrant cinematic experience. From opulent palaces to sprawling battlefields, every frame is meticulously crafted, elevating the film's grandeur to an unparalleled level.Impeccable Performances:One cannot discuss Aadipurush without praising the exceptional performances by the cast. Prabhas, in the role of Lord Ram, delivers a captivating portrayal of the noble and valiant hero. His charismatic screen presence and nuanced acting bring depth and humanity to the iconic character, making him relatable and admirable. The ever-versatile Saif Ali Khan, as the enigmatic and menacing Lankesh (Ravana), steals the show with his mesmerizing performance. His portrayal is a testament to his talent as an actor, capturing the essence of a complex and layered character flawlessly.Profound Storytelling:Aadipurush succeeds in doing justice to the timeless epic of Ramayana, reimagining it with a fresh perspective. Director Om Raut, known for his meticulous storytelling, weaves a narrative that combines elements of grandeur, emotion, and spiritual depth. The film delves into the eternal battle between good and evil, exploring the themes of righteousness, sacrifice, and the power of faith. It not only entertains but also imparts valuable lessons and moral teachings, resonating with audiences of all ages. Raut's skillful direction ensures a perfect balance between action-packed sequences and emotionally charged moments, creating a truly immersive cinematic experience.Critiquing Negative Reviews:Despite the overwhelming positive response, there are always a few individuals who fail to recognize the brilliance of Aadipurush and resort to unjustified criticism. These negative reviews often lack depth and understanding, failing to acknowledge the film's cultural significance and artistic vision. It is essential to address and challenge such opinions that undermine the hard work, dedication, and talent of the entire cast and crew.Negative reviewers often miss the point of Aadipurush, dismissing it as mere mythology or failing to appreciate its cultural importance. They overlook the fact that the film serves as a bridge between generations, keeping alive the traditions and stories that have shaped our civilization. Aadipurush's success lies in its ability to connect modern audiences with ancient mythology, igniting curiosity and preserving our rich heritage.Conclusion:Aadipurush is a cinematic masterpiece that deserves every bit of praise it receives. It brings to life an epic saga with its captivating visuals, impeccable performances, and profound storytelling. The film not only entertains but also educates, imparting timeless wisdom and fostering cultural understanding. While negative reviews exist, it is crucial to look beyond them and appreciate the film's artistic brilliance and cultural significance. Aadipurush stands as a testament to the power of cinema and its ability to transcend time, bringing stories from the past into the present and inspiring generations to come.

Sure, here is a negative review of the movie Adipurush in 600 words:Adipurush is a 2023 Indian epic mythological film based on the Hindu epic Ramayana. The film is directed by Om Raut and stars Prabhas as Lord Rama, Kriti Sanon as Sita, Saif Ali Khan as Ravana, Sunny Singh as Lakshman, Devdatta Nage as Hanuman, and Vatsal Sheth as Indrajit.The film begins with a prologue that sets the scene for the story. We are introduced to the characters of Rama, Sita, and Ravana, and we learn about their respective origins and motivations. The prologue is well-made and sets the tone for the rest of the film.The main story of the film follows Rama as he sets out to rescue Sita from Ravana. The film does a good job of following the basic plot of the Ramayana, but it also takes some creative liberties. For example, the film introduces a new character named Lankesh, who is Ravana's son and a powerful warrior. Lankesh is a welcome addition to the story, and he provides some much-needed conflict for Rama.However, the film's creative liberties are not all welcome. For example, the film changes the ending of the Ramayana, and this change is unnecessary and unsatisfying. The film also adds some unnecessary violence and gore, which is jarring and off-putting.The VFX in Adipurush are also disappointing. The film's battle scenes are particularly poorly-done, and the special effects look cheap and fake. The CGI is also used to create some unrealistic and unbelievable moments, which takes away from the overall enjoyment of the film.Overall, Adipurush is a flawed film. The performances are good, and the story is mostly faithful to the Ramayana. However, the film's creative liberties are unnecessary and unsatisfying, and the VFX are disappointing. I would not recommend Adipurush to anyone, not even fans of the Ramayana.Here are some specific criticisms of the film:* The film's ending is a major departure from the Ramayana, and it is unsatisfying and anticlimactic.* The film adds unnecessary violence and gore, which is jarring and off-putting.* The VFX in the battle scenes are poorly-done, and the CGI looks cheap and fake.* The film uses CGI to create some unrealistic and unbelievable moments, which takes away from the overall enjoyment of the film.I would give Adipurush a rating of 1 out of 10tars. It is a flawed film that is not worth your time or money.

review_title: Watch it and make up your own mind

review_title: I'm glad I didn't go by the negative reviews!!
review_text: I usually don't write reviews but seeing all the negativity spread about this movie really saddens me, hence I had to write this review.My family and I really enjoyed this movie. It's a complete entertainer. And Saif Ali Khan...take a bow, what a performance!!! He completely overshadowed others. Yes, Hanuman could have been portrayed a bit better, nonetheless it doesn't at all down my overall impression about the movie.The VFX has been criticized a lot but the improved VFX are indeed very impressive, particularly in 3D version.We have grown up seeing Sh. Ramanand Sagar's Ramayan, the Ramleela, and the 10 headed Ravan dahan whose 10 heads are arranged in a linear array. So it's easy to stereotype any presentation that is based on the Ramayan and we tend to compare everything with what we have seen and been taught since childhood. But please stop stereotyping and try to look from a different perspective. Presenting Ravan with 5 upper and 5 lower heads is indeed very creative and unique and never seen before. The Laxman rekha was also given a modern makeover which was also very innovative thought.Many say that a lot has been copied from Hollywood movies like planet of the apes etc. Why don't anyone say that planet of the apes was inspired from Ramayan? Just because they showcased talking monkeys in a movie before us doesn't mean we copied from them. Its only that our technology is far behind them but we are fast catching up. Talking animals have featured in our storybooks such as Panchatantra even before Hollywood started making such movies. Copying and taking inspiration are different things. I don't see anything wrong in taking inspiration from anywhere as long as its not a ditto replica of the original. As a video game lover, I could easily recognize that the character of Indrajeet, the electrifying effects, superpowers, among many other things, were inspired from God of War game, the rolling blades on the walls of Lankan fortress and monkeys trying to dodge them might have been inspired from the Prince of Persia game. But that's ok, we all take inspiration from things around us. Appreciate the hard work gone into making this movie a visual treat rather than criticizing it.Yes, some dialogues were indeed objectionable and not worthy of such a holy and pious epic. Apart from that, its definitely a winner for me.Stop stereotyping and you will love the movie!

review_title: Looks like if Warner Bros and Marvel collaborated to make the movie
review_text: This movie has so many elements from different movies. In programmers terms it's like if they took Transformers, Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban, Ender's Game, Game of Thrones, and Planet of Apes and ran "git merge" on them then layered a sad excuse of the Ramayana on top of it to resolve the conflicts. The giant bats of Raavan make no sense. If it actually resembled the Ramayana I might have at least given it 5 stars but I ended up focusing more on the stupidity and inaccuracies rather than the actual story. This is a complete and utter insult to the Ramayana. I find it difficult to see how you could even make a movie this bad.

This abomination masquerading as a film, Adipurush, is a disgrace to cinematic artistry. The creators have managed to butcher one of the most revered epics of all time with their utter lack of understanding and respect for the source material. It's as if they handed the Ramayana to a group of preschoolers armed with crayons and asked them to reinterpret it.The portrayal of Prabhas as a clownish caricature of a hero is an insult to his talent and the legacy of the character he's supposed to embody. Hanuman, a majestic and divine figure, has been reduced to a buffoonish SpongeBob lookalike, an absurdity that defies any logical explanation. And don't even get me started on Ravan - the menacing antagonist of the Ramayana transformed into a chapri street goon? This is an affront to storytelling and cultural heritage.Om Raut, the so-called director, should be stripped of his title for this travesty. His creative decisions are baffling at best and utterly disrespectful at worst. It's abundantly clear that he possesses neither the vision nor the competence to handle a project of this magnitude. The fact that such a blunder was allowed to reach the silver screen is a testament to the incompetence of the producers who greenlit this disaster.The absence of crucial scenes from the exile and the complete disregard for the origin of Sita further highlight the contempt with which this film treats its source material. It's as if the filmmakers deliberately set out to mock and undermine the rich narrative tapestry of the Ramayana.In the name of all that is sacred, stay far away from this cinematic abomination. Adipurush is a disgraceful mockery of a cherished epic, a shameful waste of resources, and an insult to every viewer's intelligence. It's an embarrassment to the world of filmmaking and a stain on the legacy of the Ramayana.

It was such a great opportunity to carry forward the legacy of Ramanand Sagar's Ramayan and narrate the story in an effective way. However what a crass attempt it is! Cynical it may sound but this seems to be an attempt to cash on the hindu-sentiments without having an actual conviction!God's own way of filtering what stories are to be told! I wonder whether this movie even deserve an OTT.Just checked OM Raut's (Producer + Director + Screenplay writer) wiki page which says that this movie generally received positive feedback from critics. Definitely some craft work going on with wikipedia as I didn't find a single positive comment atleast so far on IMDB.

"Adipurush" astounds with its audacious ambition but falls short in execution. The visual effects, while impressive in scale, struggle to blend seamlessly with the live-action scenes, resulting in jarring moments that take viewers out of the experience. The film's attempt to reimagine an epic tale is evident, yet the script occasionally falters, leaving character arcs underdeveloped and emotional depth lacking. However, the performances, especially by the lead actors, manage to shine through the tumultuous CGI, injecting some authenticity into the mythological narrative. "Adipurush" proves that grand visions don't always translate into greatness, leaving audiences torn between marveling at the effort and lamenting the missed potential.

This movie was incredible! What a heck of an experience. It's a journey of epic, LOTR fantasy conflict proportions. It was a very interesting, creative illustration of an ancient Sanskrit epic, Ramayana. I've never heard of it, but now I want to know more!

review_title: Adipurush: The movie that provides a great detail on the fight between the two souls of India
review_text:
What can I say man, this movie is just spectacular. The provided details that go into this movie are just unbelievable. After watching the movie, I learned about the conflict between two of the greatest fighters. The good and the bad. Even though I'm not in India, I was touched. The fight displays incredible effects. I also love the part where a person with incredible speed comes. It looked like something out of Marvel or DC. I thought effects like these only worked in anime or any type of animation, but I was clearly proved wrong. It turns out that the effects were actually good and that the animation worked out and looked good towards the final presentation. Wow man, just wow. I love this movie and this is definitely underrated. 10/10! If I had chance to give this movie an Oscar, I would. I recommend this to everyone who seeks interest in action and history. Wanna learn about something new, this movie will definitely get you involved with the mystery of the past!

review_title: Huge Disappointment with what could have been the greatest film of all time
review_text: Here are few things that are wrong with this film for the very first 1 hour.Warning: Spolers Ahead1. The first 20 minutes don't make sense and the introduction of Rama is pure cringe with cheap copies of characters from Harry Potter.2. Dialogues between Rama and Sita look like they have been written by a 15 Year old Salman Khan fan. "Sita : Bus badi badi baatein karte Hain aap", Bade aaye" SERIOUSLY?? WHO ARE YOU EVEN TALKING TO?3. Bad introduction of Ravan. The sequence of stone structures of Ravan singing and Saif playing sitar layak electric guitar makes Thugs of Hindostaan look good.4. Such bad CGI of Lanka that it looks like a video game from the year 2000.5. Poorly written dialogues between Rama and other characters.WHAT THE HELL IS A JUNGLI BUDHIYA?6. Sugriv's animated character has been copied straight from Ceaser from Planet of the Apes. They didn't even bother to make something new.7. While the fight of Bali and Sugriv was good and has been well thought of even though it's short the bad CGI of both characters make it look immensely bad.There are so many other bad things and worse things about this picture. Would add some points later here.
